1.speaker: PENGUIN
1.japanese: なんで　うまく いかないんだろう…
1.english: I wonder why it's not going well.

2.speaker: PANDA
2.english: Huh? What? Oh, that. Parallel parking?

4.speaker: PANDA
4.japanese: じゃあ　できるようになったの？
4.english: So you're able to do it now?

5.speaker: PENGUIN
5.japanese: まだ　ちゃんと　できてないけど… 違うってば！
5.english: No, not quite yet... But that's not it!

6.speaker: PENGUIN
6.japanese: 僕が言いたいのは　デートだよ デートのお誘いだよ
6.english: I'm talking about my date. I don't know how to ask someone out.

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: 会って言えば いいんじゃないの？
7.english: Why don't you just meet up with her and ask?

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.japanese: それができないから 困ってるんだよ
8.english: That's the problem!I can't bring myself to do it.

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.japanese: もう　いい… パンダくんに 相談するんじゃなかった
10.english: Never mind. It was a mistake to ask you, Panda.

11.speaker: LADY
11.english: Mr. Polar Bear! Sorry! We're a little late!

15.speaker: SASAKO
15.japanese: 昨日　言ったじゃないですか

17.speaker: MAYUMI
17.japanese: 『月刊　フラフラウォーカー』のライター 大崎と申します
17.english: Hi, I'm a writer for "Furafura Walker Monthly." My name is Ohsaki.

20.speaker: MAYUMI
20.japanese: あの…　編集長が 先に来ているはずなんですが
20.english: Um, well, our editor-in-chief should be here already. Editor-in-chief? I don't believe he's here yet.

21.speaker: MAYUMI
21.japanese: そうですか… どうしたんだろう？
21.english: I see. I wonder what happened.

22.speaker: MAYUMI
22.japanese: 実は こちらの　しろくまカフエを絶対　取り上げよう って言ったのは
22.english: Actually, the person who wanted to cover this place was our editor-in-chief. He's got a knack for finding

23.japanese: オープンカフェを見つける勘がとても鋭くて
23.english: hole-in-the-wall cafés and unique open cafés.

24.speaker: MAYUMI
24.japanese: うちの雑誌は　編集長のセンスに 支えられているようなものです
24.english: Our magazine pretty much runs on his intuition.

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.english: Did you hear? It's a piece for a magazine. Piece?

26.speaker: PENGUIN
26.japanese: いろいろ　インタビューしたり 写真撮ったりするんじゃない？
26.english: They're probably going to do a few interviews and take a lot of pictures.

27.speaker: PANDA
27.japanese: インタビュー？ 写真？

28.speaker: PANDA
28.japanese: ファンレターとか届いたりして
28.english: I wonder if I'll get fan mail.

29.speaker: PENGUIN
29.japanese: パンダくんの取材じゃないよ
29.english: The piece isn't about you, Panda. If they interview customers, our pictures will be in the magazine. That's not okay!

30.speaker: PENGUIN
30.japanese: 僕写真写り自信ないんだよ　ああ…

31.speaker: MAYUMI
31.japanese: じゃあ　とりあえず 取材を 始めさせていただきますね
31.english: Well then, let's begin our interview.

32.speaker: MAYUMI
32.japanese: まずはシロクマさんに
32.english: First, we'd like to know how it all began. How it all began {\i1}(ikisatsu){\i0}...

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.english: That would be an artistic masterpiece {\i1}(rikisaku){\i0}.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.english: That would be a police officer{\i1} (keisatsu){\i0}.

37.speaker: MAYUMI
37.japanese: あ…　えっと…　そのダジャレは…
37.english: U-Um... those puns... That would be a greeting{\i1} (aisatsu){\i0}!

38.speaker: MAYUMI
38.japanese: かぶせてきましたね編集長
38.english: Way to step right in, Mr. Editor!

39.speaker: MAYUMI
39.japanese: マスターはダジャレが得意なナイスガイ…　と
39.english: The owner is a pun-loving, nice guy.

41.speaker: MAYUMI
41.japanese: はい　うちの編集長 ハシビロコウさんです
41.english: Yes, he's our editor-in-chief, Mr. Shoebill. Right? Your lead was amazing this time!

42.speaker: MAYUMI
42.japanese: 編集長が　本当に ここは　すばらしいカフェだと
42.english: He says that this café is absolutely amazing.

44.speaker: MAYUMI
44.japanese: それでは　改めまして
44.english: So, once again, why did you decide to open this café? I guess she's going to ask him after all.

46.speaker: POLAR BEAR
46.japanese: 話せば長くなるんだけど

47.japanese: 僕はカナダのハドソン湾で生まれたの
47.english: but I was born near the Hudson Bay in Canada. I was the youngest of triplets, and the smallest.

48.speaker: POLAR BEAR
48.japanese: お母さんが食べ物を探して歩くと
48.english: Whenever my mom would go look for food,

49.speaker: POLAR BEAR
49.japanese: いつも僕だけ遅れてしまった

50.speaker: POLAR BEAR
50.japanese: そして　ある吹雪の日
50.english: Then, one day, during a snowstorm, I was completely separated from my family.

52.speaker: POLAR BEAR
52.japanese: お母さんたちの姿はどこにもなかった
52.english: I couldn't see my mom or siblings anywhere.

53.speaker: POLAR BEAR
53.japanese: 一生懸命呼んだけど 応えはない
53.english: I called out for them, but there was no answer.

54.speaker: POLAR BEAR
54.english: And then, I noticed... the piece of ice I was on was floating away.

55.speaker: POLAR BEAR
55.japanese: 僕はひとりぼっちで海の上を漂流していった
55.english: I was all alone and drifting out to sea.

57.speaker: PANDA
57.japanese: そ…　それで どうなったの？
57.english: W-What happened after that? When I'd gotten so hungry that I couldn't even move,

58.speaker: POLAR BEAR
58.japanese: 僕は通りがかった猟師の人に助けられたんだ
58.english: I was rescued by a passing fisherman.

59.speaker: POLAR BEAR
59.japanese: それから　僕は助けてくれた人の両親に預けられた
59.english: After that, he left me in his parents' care.

60.speaker: POLAR BEAR
60.japanese: そこは小さな食堂をやっていて

61.speaker: POLAR BEAR
61.english: and as I helped them out,

62.speaker: POLAR BEAR
62.japanese: 僕は料理が好きになった

63.speaker: POLAR BEAR
63.japanese: でも　そんな生活も長くは続かなかったよ
63.english: But that life didn't last long, either.

64.speaker: POLAR BEAR
64.japanese: 僕は　大きくなりすぎて
64.english: I became so big that I couldn't stay at their house anymore.

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.japanese: お店をやっていたら いつか話が伝わって
67.english: I thought if I started a café, word would eventually get around,

68.speaker: POLAR BEAR
68.japanese: お母さんたちに会えるかもしれないから
68.english: and I might be able to see my family again. Huh? What?

69.speaker: MAYUMI
69.japanese: わかります 編集長

70.speaker: MAYUMI
70.japanese: シロクマさんの大変さを思うと…
70.english: Just thinking about Mr. Polar Bear's suffering...

73.speaker: PANDA
73.japanese: お母さんたちには まだ会えないの？
73.english: Have you seen your family yet?

75.speaker: SASAKO
75.japanese: あれ？　私この前は建設会社を脱サラして
75.english: Huh? I thought you told me the other day that you quit your job at the construction company to open up the café. There's that version, too.

78.speaker: MAYUMI
78.japanese: ははぁ　真相は お好みってことですね
78.english: Oh, so we can use whichever version we like.

79.speaker: MAYUMI
79.english: Nothing less from the nice guy.

80.speaker: MAYUMI
80.japanese: じゃあ　次の質問ですが…

81.speaker: MAYUMI
81.japanese: どうしました！？　編集長！
81.english: What's wrong, Mr. Editor? Oh, those flowers. Who did these fabulous arrangements?

82.speaker: SASAKO
82.japanese: 近くの花屋さんに お願いしてるんです
82.english: A local flower shop does it for us.

88.speaker: SASAKO
88.english: It's our very own vegetable garden. We grow the vegetables and herbs that we use in the café.

89.speaker: MAYUMI
89.japanese: さすが編集長！ どんなことも見逃しませんね
89.english: You're amazing, Mr. Editor! You don't miss a thing.

93.speaker: MAYUMI
93.japanese: そんなステキなしろくまカフェさんなんですが
93.english: You have such an amazing place.

94.speaker: MAYUMI
94.japanese: オススメがあれば ぜひ紹介していただけますか？
94.english: Would you be willing to share any recommendations you have?

95.speaker: PANDA
95.japanese: 笹大盛りがオススメだよ！
95.english: I recommend the large serving of bamboo grass!

96.speaker: PENGUIN
96.japanese: それ　料理じゃなくて素材だよね
96.english: That's more like raw ingredients than food.

97.speaker: PANDA
97.japanese: あぁ　家の隣にあってすぐ来られるのもオススメ
97.english: Oh! I also recommend how it's right next to my house and easy to get to.

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.japanese: パンダくんだけでしょ

99.speaker: MAYUMI
99.japanese: 素材と立地が抜群　と…
99.english: The ingredients and location are extraordinary.

100.speaker: MAYUMI
100.english: What else? The lunch pasta is popular. The one with anchovies.

101.speaker: PANDA
101.japanese: 春野菜も　いいよね
101.english: The one with spring vegetables, too.

102.speaker: SASAKO
102.japanese: せっかくだから 食べてもらったら　どうでしょう？
102.english: Why don't we make it for them since they're here?

103.speaker: MAYUMI
103.japanese: どうですか？　編集長
103.english: What do you think, Mr. Editor?

104.speaker: PANDA
104.japanese: パスタ　嫌いなのかな？

105.speaker: POLAR BEAR
105.japanese: 意外とダイナミックだよね

106.speaker: MAYUMI
106.japanese: そうですか！ とっても　おいしいそうです
106.english: I see! He says it's very delicious!

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.japanese: えっ！？ この間の雑誌もう出たの？

109.speaker: POLAR BEAR
109.japanese: うん　サンプルが来てる
109.english: Yup. I received a sample copy. Let me see, let me see!

112.speaker: PENGUIN
112.english: I'm in it. It appears so. Polar Bear's Café Polar Bear's Café

114.speaker: POLAR BEAR
114.japanese: おはよう　パンダくん

115.speaker: PANDA
115.japanese: あれ！？　これ　なんの荷物？

116.speaker: POLAR BEAR
116.english: I'm getting ready for a trip.

117.speaker: PANDA
117.japanese: えっ！？　出かけちゃうの？ カフェは？
117.english: You're going on a trip? What about the café?

118.speaker: POLAR BEAR
118.english: It's closed for the day. What?

119.speaker: PANDA
119.japanese: せっかく　早起きできたからモーニング食べようと思ったのに
119.english: But I got up early, so I figured I could make it in time for breakfast.

123.speaker: GRIZZLY
123.japanese: シロクマ！ 用意はできてんだろうな？
123.english: You better be ready, Polar Bear.

126.speaker: PANDA
126.japanese: グリズリーさんおはよう

128.speaker: PANDA
128.japanese: シロクマくんとどこ行くの？
128.english: Where are you two headed? We're gonna go get some ingredients.

129.speaker: POLAR BEAR
129.japanese: 料理の材料を発掘しに
129.english: We're going to go excavate for some ingredients for cooking.

131.speaker: PANDA
131.english: I wanna go, too. This ain't no game!

132.speaker: POLAR BEAR
132.japanese: まぁ　でも 遠足みたいなものかな
132.english: Well, it is sort of like a field trip.

134.speaker: PANDA
134.japanese: 笹はおやつに入る？ ごはんかな？
134.english: Will there be bamboo grass for snacks? Or maybe lunch?

136.speaker: POLAR BEAR
136.japanese: アザラシはごはんだけど…

138.speaker: POLAR BEAR
138.english: Maybe walruses. What the hell are you babbling about?

139.english: Let's go! Hurry and get in!

141.speaker: POLAR BEAR
141.japanese: 何？　グリズリーくん

142.speaker: GRIZZLY
142.japanese: なんでアイツがいるんだよ？
142.english: Why the hell is he here? You told him to get in.

143.speaker: GRIZZLY
143.english: That's not what I meant! It doesn't really matter.

145.japanese: 山？　それとも　海？
145.english: To the mountains? Or maybe to the beach?

146.speaker: PANDA
146.japanese: 山はおいしい笹がいっぱい生えてるし…
146.english: There's lots of delicious bamboo grass in the mountains.

147.speaker: PANDA
147.japanese: 海はかわいい女の子がいっぱいいるよね
147.english: And there're a lot of cute girls at the beach.

149.speaker: GRIZZLY
149.japanese: お前は店で出す分が欲しいんだろ？
149.english: You want some for your café, right?

150.speaker: POLAR BEAR
150.japanese: うん　いっぱい獲れるといいな
150.english: Yup. It'd be great if we catch get a lot.

151.speaker: GRIZZLY
151.japanese: 結構いそうな感じだぜ
151.english: It looks like there's quite a few.

153.speaker: GRIZZLY
153.japanese: あれが俺たちの獲物だ
153.english: That would be our target. That?

155.speaker: GRIZZLY
155.english: What? I was imagining something more like bamboo shoots.

156.speaker: GRIZZLY
156.english: If you don't want any, go home!

157.speaker: PANDA
157.japanese: なんだ…　発掘じゃないじゃない
157.english: This isn't an excavation at all.

158.speaker: POLAR BEAR
158.japanese: 似たようなもんでしょ

161.speaker: POLAR BEAR
161.japanese: 明日からのしろくまカフェのランチ
161.english: Starting tomorrow, lunch at Polar Bear's Café

162.speaker: POLAR BEAR
162.japanese: グリズリー君にかかってるんだから
162.english: is all riding on you, Grizzly.

163.speaker: GRIZZLY
163.japanese: まったく…　他力本願なヤツめ
163.english: Jeez, relying on me to do all your work.

164.speaker: PANDA
164.japanese: えっ　どうやって獲るの？
164.english: Ooh, how's he going to catch it?

167.speaker: GRIZZLY
167.japanese: まぁ　俺の手にかかりゃ こんなもんよ

169.speaker: PANDA
169.japanese: わぁ…　ピチピチしてる
169.english: They're wiggling around. I faced a situation like this as a kid, too...

171.speaker: GRIZZLY
171.english: I can't catch any of them.

172.speaker: GRIZZLY
172.japanese: なんだシロクマ！　テメエ！ 笑って見てんじゃねえ！
172.english: What the hell's your problem, Polar Bear?! Don't stand there laughing!

174.speaker: GRIZZLY
174.japanese: 笑ってるだろうが　口がよ！

175.speaker: POLAR BEAR
175.japanese: 口の下が黒いだけだよ
175.english: It's just that my bottom lip is black.

176.speaker: GRIZZLY
176.japanese: ホントだ　口　閉じてる
176.english: You're right, your mouth is closed.

178.speaker: GRIZZLY
178.japanese: やっぱ　笑ってんじゃねえか！
178.english: You are laughing, you ass! Couldn't help it.

179.speaker: GRIZZLY
179.japanese: アイツに笑われてた俺も
179.english: He may have been laughing then,

180.japanese: 今じゃ　立派にサケが獲れるようになったんだぜ
180.english: but I can catch salmon like no other now. What the hell are you doing? {eh?} Getting ready for a picnic.

181.speaker: GRIZZLY
181.japanese: 俺が働いてるときに何だそりゃ！
181.english: What the hell are you doing while I'm doing all the work?!

182.speaker: POLAR BEAR
182.japanese: まぁまぁ　グリズリーくんがサケ獲って お腹が空いたら
182.english: Now, now, when you get hungry from catching all the salmon,

183.speaker: POLAR BEAR
183.japanese: ランチができてるってわけ
183.english: I'll have lunch ready for you.

184.speaker: POLAR BEAR
184.japanese: なかなか　いいでしょ

185.speaker: GRIZZLY
185.japanese: 腹にたまるもんを頼むぜ
185.english: Make something that'll fill me up. There aren't any salmon. What the hell are you doing?!

186.speaker: PANDA
186.japanese: なかなか グリズリーさんみたいにはいかないね
186.english: I can't seem to get the hang of it like you, Mr. Grizzly. It totally looked like anyone could do it.

187.speaker: GRIZZLY
187.japanese: いいか　よく見てろ
187.english: Jeez, watch closely. This is how it's—

188.speaker: PANDA
188.japanese: もういいや　笹食べよっと
188.english: I'm done. I'm gonna go eat bamboo grass.

189.speaker: GRIZZLY
189.japanese: そんな簡単に諦めんな！
189.english: Don't wuss out so easily! But I'm tired, and I'm hungry.

190.speaker: GRIZZLY
190.japanese: そういう問題じゃねえ！

191.speaker: GRIZZLY
191.japanese: 同じクマとして　シロクマ！お前もコイツに何か言ってやれ！
191.english: You're a bear, too, Polar Bear! Talk to him!

192.speaker: POLAR BEAR
192.japanese: パンダくんは 竹と笹があれば満足だから
192.english: Panda is happy if he has his bamboo and bamboo grass.

195.speaker: GRIZZLY
195.japanese: クマは狩りだろ 狩ってこそのクマだろ！
195.english: If you're a bear, hunt! Hunting is what makes you a bear!

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.japanese: ちょっとそこでとってきた

198.speaker: POLAR BEAR
198.japanese: これだったら　パンダくんも狩りをする気になるでしょ
198.english: This will probably make Panda want to hunt, too.

200.speaker: PANDA
200.japanese: えっ　サケってタケノコ食べるの？

202.speaker: GRIZZLY
202.japanese: お前が食うんだよ　パンダ
202.english: You're going to eat it, Panda.

204.speaker: POLAR BEAR
204.japanese: グリズリーくんが 狩りのお手本見せてくれるって
204.english: Grizzly's going to show you how to hunt.

205.speaker: POLAR BEAR
205.japanese: 狩りをしてこそのクマだもんね
205.english: Hunting is what makes you a bear, right? Y-Yeah! Watch closely, Panda.

206.speaker: POLAR BEAR
206.japanese: まずは　標的を見つける

207.speaker: POLAR BEAR
207.english: Don't ever take your eyes off of it.

208.speaker: POLAR BEAR
208.japanese: 獲物の動きを予測する
208.english: Predict how your enemy will move.

209.speaker: GRIZZLY
209.japanese: どうだ　やってみろ
209.english: How's that? Now you do it.

211.speaker: GRIZZLY
211.japanese: って食ってんじゃねえ！

212.speaker: GRIZZLY
212.japanese: ちゃんと泳いでるタケノコをとれ
212.english: Come catch the swimming bamboo shoot!

213.speaker: POLAR BEAR
213.japanese: タケノコは泳がないよ

216.speaker: PANDA
216.japanese: イライラしないで　グリズリーさん
216.english: Don't be so mad, Mr. Grizzly.

217.speaker: PANDA
217.japanese: 僕のとっておきの笹あげるから
217.english: I'll give you my best bamboo grass.

218.speaker: PANDA
218.japanese: 笹は健康にもいいんだよ
218.english: It's really good for your health, too.

219.speaker: GRIZZLY
219.japanese: お前も食わず嫌いしてないで
219.english: Don't be a picky eater yourself, and eat some salmon. Okay.

221.speaker: GRIZZLY
221.japanese: あんまし　うまくねえ
221.english: Not that good. Isn't the salmon better? Not really.

227.speaker: PANDA
227.japanese: いっぱいとれてよかったね
227.english: It's good that you caught so much.

229.speaker: GRIZZLY
229.japanese: おい　パンダ！　こっちだ

231.speaker: SASAKO
231.japanese: おかげさまで大人気ですよ　ランチパスタ
231.english: The lunch pasta is a hit, thanks to you.

235.speaker: POLAR BEAR
235.english: It's for all your hard work yesterday.

236.speaker: GRIZZLY
236.japanese: おい　パンダ　俺のタケノコお前にやる
236.english: Hey, Panda, I'll give you my bamboo shoots. I'll give you my salmon, Mr. Grizzly.

237.speaker: SASAKO
237.japanese: あ　好き嫌いはダメですよ
237.english: It's not good to be such picky eaters.

238.speaker: GRIZZLY
238.japanese: 細かいこと気にするなよ

241.speaker: PANDA
241.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

242.speaker: PENGUIN
242.english: What is it, Panda? Please tell me all the life lessons you have learned so far.

243.speaker: PENGUIN
243.japanese: 飲み会で最後に残った一個を食べる時は
243.english: When you're out drinking with others, and you're trying to eat the last piece,

244.speaker: PENGUIN
244.japanese: お皿を下げてもらうどさくさで食べちゃえば
244.english: if you try to eat it as they're taking the plate,

246.speaker: PANDA
246.japanese: 心の底から小さい知恵だね
246.english: That is a truly shallow life lesson.

248.speaker: POLAR BEAR
248.english: Next time, on Polar Bear's Café Z.
